result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse D. Larrabee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence specifically Dunn County Case Nos. 2009CF148 & 2009CF233.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse D. Larrabee

records.addlTxt: DOC - Notice of Case Status Change Slip - Discharge

Civil rights restored:
1. The right to vote.
2. The obligation for jury duty.
The following civil rights not restored:
1. Firearms may not be used or possessed unless a pardon, which does not restrict possession of firearms, is
received from the governor.
2. Public office cannot be held unless a pardon is obtained from the governor.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jesse D. Larrabee in court with attorney Mandy L. Caffee.  Defendant Jesse D. Larrabee in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel received PSI, no corrections.  No witnesses.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 3 yrs. probation consecutive to any other sentence, specifically Dunn County Case Nos. 09CF148 & 233.  Condition of probation:  waive court costs & DNA surcharge.  Provide DNA sample; no other violations of law; comply with any counseling or assessment set up by P&P.

Order to Transport.
The Court Finds the above named person is currently being held at Jackson Correctional Inst.
The warden/superintendent with physical custody of the person subject to this order at the time of its execution shall make that person available to the sheriff of Pepin County.  The sheriff shall convey that person to 740 7th Avenue West for proceedings in the Circuit Court of Pepin County on  August 5, 2014 at 11:00 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on August 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Order to Transport.
The warden/superintendent with physical custody of the person subject to this order at the time of its execution shall make that person available to the sheriff of Pepin County.  The sheriff shall convey that person to 740 7th Avenue West for proceedings in the Circuit Court of Pepin County on  6/9/14 at 10:00 a.m.

Defendant Jesse D. Larrabee in court with attorney Mandy L Caffee.  Defendant Jesse D. Larrabee in custody.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel agrees to use complaint for Information purposes.  Advised of elements/max penalties of Count 1 Possession of Meth.  Advised of felony conviction penalties.  Defendant pleads guilty.  PLQ/WRF filed & reviewed with defendant.  Court finds defendant's WCR & Plea done K&V, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  Order PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on April 21, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Attorney Mandy L. Caffee appeared by phone means with Defendant Jesse D. Larrabee appear in court. Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives time limits for P.H.

Defendant Jesse D. Larrabee in court with attorney Susan T Falch.  Defendant Jesse D. Larrabee in custody.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Defendant currently on probation hold.  Cash bond set at $500 so gets sentence credit.  Defendant agrees to continue initial appearance.  Matter cont'd for representation by Atty Caffee.
